channel.title: Amazon Web Services Service Status
Current service status feed for Amazon Web Services.
channel.generator: AWS Service Health Dashboard RSS Generator

item.title: Informational message: Increased VPC endpoint error rates for S3
item.description: Between 2:26 PM and 2:55 PM PST we experienced increased error rates accessing VPC endpoints for S3 in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Informational message: Elevated email-sending API error rates
item.description: Between 2:26 PM and 2:55 PM PST in the US-EAST-1 Region, customers experienced elevated error rates sending email to the SES SMTP interface. During that time, a portion of requests failed with a temporary authentication failure. Requests to the SES HTTP interface were unaffected, and all requests accepted successfully by SES have been processed normally. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Packet loss
item.description: Between 5:40 AM and 8:20 AM PST we experienced packet loss between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region. An external facility providing Direct Connect connectivity to the EU-WEST-1 Region experienced power loss. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Informational message: Packet loss
item.description: We have recovered power in the impacted facility and are continuing to investigate and resolve intermittent packet loss and latency between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region.

item.title: Informational message: [RESOLVED] Packet loss
item.description: We can confirm intermittent packet loss between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region. An external facility providing Direct Connect connectivity to the EU-WEST-1 Region has experienced power loss. We are working with the service provider to mitigate impact and restore power.

item.title: Informational message: [RESOLVED] Packet loss
item.description: We are investigating packet loss between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region.

item.title: Informational message: Packet loss
item.description: We are investigating packet loss between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands', and the EU-WEST-1 Region.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Delayed metrics in US-WEST-2
item.description: Between 02:14 AM PST and 05:51 AM PST in the US-WEST-2 Region, customers experienced increased delays in some metrics. During that time, alarms on delayed metrics may have transitioned into an INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics are in the process of backfilling in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The CloudWatch service is operating normally.

item.title: Informational message: Delayed metrics in US-WEST-2
item.description: We confirm continued delays to some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region. We continue to work to resolve the issue.

item.title: Informational message: Delayed metrics in US-WEST-2
item.description: We confirm continued delays to some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region. We continue to work to resolve the issue.

item.title: Informational message: Delayed metrics in US-WEST-2
item.description: We continue to work to resolve the delays affecting some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region.

item.title: Informational message: Delayed metrics in US-WEST-2
item.description: We can confirm delays in some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region. We are actively working to resolve the issue.

item.title: Informational message: Delayed metrics in US-WEST-2
item.description: We are investigating increased delays for CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region. CloudWatch alarms may transition into "INSUFFICIENT_DATA" state if set on delayed metrics.

item.title: Service is operating normally: Increased instance launch error rates and degraded volume performance
item.description: Between 9:15 AM and 10:47 AM PST, we experienced increased error rates for EBS-backed instance launches and degraded volume performance for a small number of volumes in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-1 Region. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Informational message: Increased instance launch error rates and degraded volume performance
item.description: We can confirm increased error rates for new EBS-backed instance launches and degraded volume performance for a small number of volumes in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-1 Region. We are currently working to resolve this issue.
